extracurricular_activities: eersteklasmusical (onder begeleiding van vijfde- en zesdeklassers)

facilities.classrooms_labs_quality: Central Amsterdam location with access to urban cultural and academic resources

technology.description: beamers, computers in mediatheek en ICT-lab

student_support.counseling: Auxilia HLP: extra hulples Nederlands, wiskunde, begrijpend lezen, spelling en studievaardigheden, plusmentor, hulpmentoren, Barlabijles, huiswerklokaal voor alle jaarlagen, gerichte Auxilia (ondersteuning) voor allerlei vakken door het jaar heen
special_education: remedial teacher (voor o.a. faalangst en dyslexie)
voor hoogbegaafden ruimte voor uitdagingen buiten school

safety_measures: iedere leraar maakt eigen orde in de klas
environment.culture_values: One of the Netherlands' oldest educational institutions dating to 1342 as a Latin school. Named Barlaeus Gymnasium in the 1930s. Emphasizes being 'smart, flexible, and beautiful' in its educational approach. Nearly seven centuries of sustained educational commitment.

public_transport.accessibility_info: tram 1, 2, 5, 11, 12, halte Leidseplein, tram 1, 7 en 19 halte spiegelgracht, en diverse buslijnen

awards: One of Netherlands' most established academic institutions (founded 1342)

admission_info: Voorrangsregels: voorrang voor broertjes en/of zusjes van zittende leerlingen en kinderen van personeel die op 1 augustus 2010 op de notarieel vastgelegde lijsten staan

strengths: Central Amsterdam location with cultural resources
considerations: Classical focus may not suit all learning styles
Central Amsterdam location - significant commute from Amstelveen
best_fit_for: Academically exceptional students interested in classical education
Students passionate about Latin, Greek, and classical civilization
Families valuing historical prestige and tradition
Students who benefit from small school environment
Those wanting access to Amsterdam's cultural resources
ai_analysis.summary: Barlaeus Gymnasium is one of the Netherlands' most prestigious and oldest educational institutions, with roots dating to 1342 as a Latin school. This mid-sized categoraal gymnasium serves approximately 800 students with an excellent 8.9:1 student-teacher ratio in central Amsterdam. Emphasizing a 'smart, flexible, and beautiful' approach, Barlaeus provides rigorous classical education with Latin and Greek. The central location offers students unique access to Amsterdam's cultural and academic resources while maintaining nearly 700 years of educational tradition and excellence.
